safety_edibility_notes: Farmed commercially for meat, leather, and feathers. Ostrich meat is lean and low in cholesterol. Farm-raised birds are widely consumed.
safety_warning_text: Ostriches kill 2-3 people per year, more deaths than crocodiles in Africa. Their powerful legs can deliver kicks with 2,000 PSI force. Claws can disembowel a human.
safety_summary: Ostriches are dangerous, especially during breeding season. Their forward kicks can kill a lion. A 10 cm claw on each foot can cause fatal lacerations. Never corner or approach breeding ostriches.
safety_contraindications: Do not turn your back on ostriches
Never run in straight line from ostrich
encounter_protocol: Stay in vehicle. If on foot and charged, lie flat on ground (ostrich cannot kick effectively at ground level) or find barrier. Do not run straight - zigzag if must flee.
